savedBooks.title: A Christmas Carol
savedBooks.author: Charles Dickens
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the bustling, foggy streets of Victorian London, Ebenezer Scrooge, a miserly old businessman, spends his days counting coins and shunning the cheer of Christmas, much to the dismay of his overworked clerk, Bob Cratchit, and his jovial nephew, Fred. On a chilling Christmas Eve, Scrooge is visited by the ghost of his long-dead partner, Jacob Marley, who appears bound in chains and warns of a spectral journey ahead. Three spirits—the nostalgic Ghost of Christmas Past, the hearty Ghost of Christmas Present, and the ominous Ghost of Christmas Yet to Come—soon arrive, each guiding Scrooge through visions of his life and the lives of those around him, from forgotten joys to present struggles. Dickens’ heartwarming story unfolds as a festive exploration of regret, compassion, and the chance for renewal, set against a backdrop of snowy streets and glowing hearths.

savedBooks.title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
savedBooks.author: Mark Twain
savedBooks.sypnosis: Along the muddy banks of the Mississippi River in the pre-Civil War South, Huckleberry Finn, a scrappy boy raised in a rough-and-tumble world, escapes his harsh father and sets out on a raft with Jim, a runaway slave with a gentle spirit. Their journey downstream introduces them to a colorful array of characters: smooth-talking con men, feuding families with rifles at the ready, and townsfolk caught up in their own quirks and prejudices. As Huck and Jim drift through lazy days and starry nights, they navigate the river’s bends and the challenges of a society divided by race and morality, forming a bond that tests Huck’s understanding of right and wrong. Twain’s lively narrative paints a vivid picture of adventure and human complexity, capturing the humor and heart of life along the water’s edge.

savedBooks.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
savedBooks.author: Oscar Wilde
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the elegant drawing rooms of Victorian London, Dorian Gray, a young man of striking beauty, becomes the muse of painter Basil Hallward, who captures his likeness in a breathtaking portrait. Introduced to the witty and cynical Lord Henry Wotton, Dorian is swept into a world of hedonistic ideas, sparking a fascination with eternal youth and pleasure that alters his outlook. As he embarks on a life of indulgence, surrounded by the opulence of high society and the shadows of its underbelly, Dorian notices something strange about the portrait that now hangs in his home, hinting at a mysterious connection to his actions. Wilde’s gothic tale weaves a web of beauty, temptation, and introspection, exploring the allure of a life unbound by consequence against the backdrop of a morally rigid era.

savedBooks.title: Frankenstein or The Modern Prometheus
savedBooks.author: Mary Shelley
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the shadowed halls of a university in Ingolstadt, Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant and ambitious student, becomes consumed by a daring quest to unlock the secrets of life itself, driven by a mix of scientific curiosity and personal tragedy. Working in isolation, he constructs a being from scavenged parts, bringing it to life in a moment of triumph that quickly turns to dread as he confronts the reality of his creation. The creature, towering and misunderstood, wanders into a world that shuns it, forcing Victor to grapple with the consequences of his actions as their paths begin to intertwine. Shelley’s haunting narrative unfolds across icy landscapes and quiet villages, weaving a tale of creation, responsibility, and the search for belonging in a gothic framework that lingers with unease.

savedBooks.title: A Tale of Two Cities
savedBooks.author: Charles Dickens
savedBooks.sypnosis: Set against the turbulent backdrop of the French Revolution, this sweeping story bridges the bustling streets of London and the restless chaos of Paris, where the lives of a diverse cast begin to converge. Dr. Alexandre Manette, a former prisoner of the Bastille, is reunited with his gentle daughter Lucie after years of confinement, while Charles Darnay, a Frenchman with a complicated heritage, seeks a new life across the Channel. Meanwhile, Sydney Carton, a disillusioned lawyer with a sharp mind dulled by drink, finds himself drawn to Lucie’s quiet strength, setting the stage for a tale of sacrifice and unrest. Dickens crafts a vivid world of cobblestone alleys, revolutionary fervor, and personal struggles, where the echoes of ‘liberty, equality, fraternity’ ripple through the lives of those caught in history’s storm.

savedBooks.title: Pride and Prejudice
savedBooks.author: Jane Austen
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the rolling countryside of Regency England, Elizabeth Bennet, a sharp-witted young woman, lives with her four sisters and fretful mother, who is eager to secure them all advantageous marriages due to their modest circumstances. The arrival of the charming Mr. Bingley and his reserved friend Mr. Darcy at nearby Netherfield Park stirs the small community, setting off a flurry of balls, visits, and whispered speculations. Elizabeth finds herself at odds with Darcy’s aloof demeanor, sparking a lively clash of personalities that draws them into a web of misunderstandings and unspoken tensions. Alongside her family’s quirks—her father’s dry humor, her mother’s matchmaking zeal, and her sisters’ varied pursuits—the story unfolds with a cast of colorful figures like the pompous Mr. Collins and the dashing yet dubious Mr. Wickham, all navigating the delicate dance of love, pride, and social expectation in Austen’s witty exploration of human connection.

savedBooks.title: The Mysterious Affair at Styles
savedBooks.author: Agatha Christie
savedBooks.sypnosis: At Styles Court, a sprawling country manor in the English countryside, the sudden death of its wealthy matriarch, Emily Inglethorp, disrupts the household and draws the attention of Hercule Poirot, a meticulous Belgian detective with a flair for order. Captain Hastings, recovering from war wounds, narrates as Poirot arrives to investigate, greeted by a family full of secrets: a much-younger husband, a pair of stepsons with strained ties, and a lively young companion. The air buzzes with suspicion as Poirot examines locked rooms, cryptic notes, and the lingering scent of poison, his ‘little grey cells’ humming with curiosity. Christie’s debut introduces a classic whodunit, rich with misdirection and the quiet charm of a rural estate hiding more than it reveals.

savedBooks.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
savedBooks.author: Lewis Carroll
savedBooks.sypnosis: On a lazy summer afternoon, curious Alice spots a White Rabbit in a waistcoat, hurrying along with a pocket watch and muttering about being late, prompting her to follow him down a peculiar rabbit hole. She tumbles into Wonderland, a strange and whimsical land where she encounters a host of eccentric characters: a grinning Cheshire Cat, a Mad Hatter hosting an endless tea party, and a hot-tempered Queen of Hearts fond of croquet and commands. As Alice navigates this topsy-turvy world—shrinking and growing with mysterious potions and cakes—she faces absurd situations, from debating a philosophical Caterpillar to joining a game with flamingos as mallets. Carroll’s fantastical tale brims with playful riddles and surreal encounters, inviting readers into a dreamlike realm where the rules of reality bend and a young girl’s curiosity leads her through a maze of wonder and oddity.

savedBooks.title: Wuthering Heights
savedBooks.author: Emily Brontë
savedBooks.sypnosis: Set against the wild, windswept moors of Yorkshire, this brooding tale begins as a curious traveler, Lockwood, rents Thrushcross Grange and learns of the nearby Wuthering Heights, a rugged estate steeped in mystery. There, he meets Heathcliff, a dark and intense man with a stormy past, and hears from the housekeeper Nelly Dean about his deep connection to Catherine Earnshaw, a spirited woman raised alongside him. Their bond, forged in childhood amidst the harsh beauty of the moors, is tested by societal divides and the arrival of the refined Linton family, stirring jealousy and unspoken longing. Brontë weaves a gothic atmosphere of raw emotion and eerie isolation, where the landscape mirrors the turbulent passions of its inhabitants, hinting at a saga of love and conflict that reverberates through the years.
